contextId.information: The nomadic tribes in Kedar used black goat skins to build their homes. The woman is comparing her skin to these tents. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: dark like the tents of Kedar

contextId.information: Doves are symbols of purity, innocence, gentleness and love. AT: "your eyes are gentle and lovely like the eyes of doves. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])

The man means that the woman is far more beautiful and precious than all the other young women, just as a lily is far more beautiful and precious than all of the thorn bushes that might surround it. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])

As an apricot tree is more comforting and delightful than any of the other trees in the forest so the woman's beloved is more comforting and delightful than all the other young men. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: As an apricot tree ... the young men

contextId.information: The woman compares her beloved with a gazelle and a young buck because he is fast, beautiful, and graceful like these animals. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: like a gazelle or a young stag

contextId.information: Goats are often dark in color and when they walk on the mountains their hair would look like the long waves in a woman's hair. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
This phrase compares the color of the woman's lips with scarlet thread. AT: "are a deep red like scarlet thread." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: are like a thread of scarlet

contextId.information: Pomegranates are smooth, round, and have a rich red color. AT: "are rosy and round like two halves of a pomegranate." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
AT: "neck is long and beautiful like." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
This explains that his cheeks are like beds of spices because they both give off wonderful smells. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
The woman's navel is perfectly shaped like a bowl. AT: "Your belly button is shaped perfectly like a round bowl." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: Your navel is like a round bowl

contextId.information: The lover compares her neck to a tower made of ivory. (Simile: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: Your neck is like a tower of ivory

contextId.information: The woman is compared to Mount Carmel that rises up above everything else around it. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: head on you is like Carmel

contextId.information: "You stand up like a date palm tree." The woman is tall, stands straight, and is attractive just like a date palm. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: Your height is like that of a date palm tree

contextId.information: AT: "I want to taste your mouth like the best wine. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: May your mouth be like the best wine

contextId.information: The woman wishes that she could show her lover her affection in public as she could do her brother. She is not saying that a woman is allowed to make love with her brother. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
"as tough as Sheol." Sheol never allows people to come back to life after they have already died. Love is as persistent as Sheol because it never changes. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
